stadium.name: The Aegis Field
stadium.description: A pristine field within the main temple compound, used as the central training ground for the Shield. The pitch is bordered by the library and monastery, and is said to be protected by the twin lights, Dawn's Hope and Silver Twilight.

stats.pregame_ritual: Tying their bootlaces together and hopping to the starting line.
Re-taping their shield's handle with fresh leather.
Whispering a secret fear to the Trollball before the game.
Drinking a full waterskin of lukewarm water.
Drawing a detailed, anatomically incorrect diagram of a troll's head.
Passing a 'team luckstone' from player to player without speaking.
Chewing a specific, bitter root said to improve night vision.
Jogging three laps around the perimeter of the field.
Kissing their biceps and whispering words of encouragement to them.
Trying to teach a stray dog a complicated and useless new trick.
Challenging a spectator to a game of tic-tac-toe in the dirt.
Re-taping their shield's handle with fresh leather.
Whispering a secret fear to the Trollball before the game.

Challenging a spectator to a game of tic-tac-toe in the dirt.

stadium.name: The Prismatic Pavilion
stadium.description: A massive, permanent, open-air fairground pavilion built on stilts over the Starlight Lagoon. The field is a chaotic mix of colorful stage-planks, constantly surrounded by the Prismatic Troupe's performers.

stats.pregame_ritual: Sticking a specific type of feather in their helmet's plume.
Jogging three laps around the perimeter of the field.
Getting a teammate to punch them in the shoulder, hard.
Tracing an invisible, complex sigil over their heart.
Performing a series of aggressive, theatrical poses.
Leading the team in a synchronized chant that slowly gets louder.
Staring at their reflection in a bucket of water until they feel 'ready'.
Telling a terrible joke to the Trollball to 'loosen it up'.
Staring intently at their gauntlets, as if for the first time.
Plucking a single hair from a teammate's beard for luck.
Trying to start a 'slow clap' with the audience before the game has begun.
Tracing an invisible, complex sigil over their heart.
Leading the team in a synchronized chant that slowly gets louder.
Staring intently at their gauntlets, as if for the first time.
Trying to start a 'slow clap' with the audience before the game has begun.
Jogging three laps around the perimeter of the field.
Telling a terrible joke to the Trollball to 'loosen it up'.

preGame:
Step right up, ladies and gentle-fiends, to the hallowed and‚Äîlet‚Äôs be honest‚Äîstiflingly clean Aegis Field! I‚Äôm your host, Nok the Corrupter, coming to you live from the Temple of Light Compound where the grass is as manicured as a High Prince‚Äôs eyebrows! We‚Äôre kicking off the Losers Bracket Playoffs, and the atmosphere is thicker than a swamp-troll's hide! The stakes are sky-high, folks; it's a Best of 3 series, and the loser of this set is going straight into the dark, dusty corners of the elimination pile! üèüÔ∏è

On my left, we have the Starlight Bazaar Bizarres, fresh off the stilts of the Prismatic Lagoon! I caught a glimpse of Essa Pattie earlier, meticulously sticking a very specific feather into his helmet‚Äôs plume. Gagliano Tallbott was seen whispering a terrible joke to the Trollball‚Äîapparently, he thinks the leather needs to 'loosen up' before it tastes the dirt! Milo Nelie is over there tracing sigils over his heart, probably praying to some fey spirit that doesn't exist, but golly, it sure looks professional! üé™

And on my right... *sigh*... the Haven Lights. These shiny shield-slickers are playing on their home turf, surrounded by the library and the monastery. Shiroma Salim is obsessively re-taping his Kirkhammer's handle, while Zwart Bunns is actually whispering his secret fears to the ball! How touching! It‚Äôs enough to make a demon want to retch if the promise of a broken limb wasn't just minutes away! The Twinlights of Dawn‚Äôs Hope and Silver Twilight are shining down, but let‚Äôs hope we see some real darkness on the pitch today! üïØÔ∏è

It‚Äôs a quiet crowd today, folks‚Äîseems the Zmeigorod Snessengers have hogged all the fans again‚Äîbut don't let the empty seats fool you! These teams are desperate, and desperation is the finest seasoning for a Trollball stew! Grab your snacks and keep your eyes on the goals, because the playoffs wait for no soul! Let‚Äôs get to the action! üçøüí•
postGame:
Great galloping gargoyles, what a display of righteous wreckage! The Haven Lights have defended their pristine pitch, but they certainly didn't do it with 'mercy' or 'grace'! They did it with a good old-fashioned beating! The final score stands at 4 to 1 in favor of the Lights, giving them a 1-0 lead in this Best of 3 series! The fans who did show up got a real treat, seeing the Bizarres get bounced around like a sack of turnips! ü¶¥üí•

The action started hot and heavy in Center Field! Melesa Zelten grabbed that troll head early, but the Haven defense was hungrier than a pack of King Nezmear's werewolves! Farand Keil set the tone by absolutely leveling Willa Lois, sending them straight to the healer‚Äôs tent! Not to be outdone, Shiroma Salim‚Äîwho I‚Äôm told is a real 'hero' of the realm‚Äîdecided Pompei Hephzipa didn't need to be standing anymore and put him on the turf with a sickening thud! üöë

And folks, Tybi Reo was a one-woman wrecking crew in the first half! She lunged out and caught Kristin Kronfeld with a tackle so fierce I could hear the armor buckling from the press box! It‚Äôs wonderful to see these temple-dwellers embrace the true spirit of the Everwar‚Äîpure, unadulterated violence! Zwart Bunns even got in on the fun, injuring Demp Chet just before the whistle. It was a bloodbath in the middle of the field, and I loved every second of it! üî®

Halftime came just in time for the Bizarres to scrape their players off the stage-planks. After a quick respawn and some 'Hallowed Ground' healing, we were back at it! But the break didn't change the momentum. Marlane Lounge, looking like a rogue out of Sawyer's own circus, came out swinging and put Bush Heiner out of commission immediately! Then Tybi Reo reminded Gagliano Tallbott that jokes don't win games by knocking him flat on his back! ü§°

The Bizarres finally found a spark of life when Aggri Cookie went on a tear! He dodged through the white-and-silver line like a greased pig and fired a beautiful pass to Milo Nelie in the End Zone! Milo didn't miss, dunking that head right into the basket for the Bizarres' first‚Äîand only‚Äîpoint of the match! A brief moment of glory for the lagoon-dwellers, but alas, it was just a candle in a hurricane! üïØÔ∏èüí®

That‚Äôs when Marlane Lounge decided to put on a shooting clinic that would make Sir Randy blush! From way back in Center Field, Marlane let fly with a shot that sailed through the air like a guided bolt! **BOOM!** Two points on the board for the Haven Lights! It was a masterpiece of precision, even if it came from a team that probably spends their weekends helping old ladies cross the street. Disgusting, really, but effective! üéØ

But wait, there‚Äôs more! Before the Bizarres could even catch their breath, Riffle Heyde secured possession and the ball found its way back to Marlane. Like a repeat of a nightmare, Lounge stepped up and fired again from the center! **WHAM!** Another 2-point shoot! The Haven Lights' lead ballooned to 4 to 1 faster than Elspeth Ortell can whip up a batch of ritual sangria! The Bizarres' defense was looking more like a wet paper towel than a professional Trollball team! üç∑

I must say, I‚Äôm disappointed the Bizarres couldn't pull it together. I was rooting for a bit more chaos from the fey troupe, but they seemed more interested in hitting the dirt than hitting their marks. Kython is going to have some harsh words for his performers after this one! The Haven Lights might act all 'benevolent' like Nikos Thanae, but they showed a real mean streak today that would make Lord Orzalon crack a tiny, terrifying smile. üòà

The stadium's 'Shield's Watch' was definitely in effect, as the Bazaar's offense seemed to crumble every time they got close to the goal. You could practically feel the judgment radiating from the monastery walls! It‚Äôs hard to play ball when you‚Äôve got a thousand years of boring tradition staring you down, isn't it? The Bizarres were outmatched, out-hit, and out-shot from start to finish! ‚õ™

So, as the sun sets over the Temple Compound, the Haven Lights take the first game of this playoff series! They‚Äôre one step closer to staying alive in the bracket, while the Starlight Bazaar Bizarres are staring into the abyss of the Losers Bracket's loser pile! Can the fey circus bounce back, or will the Lights extinguish their playoff dreams in Game 2? üåô

This is Nok the Corrupter, signing off from a very bloody, very holy Aegis Field! Remember, in Trollball, if you aren't bleeding, you aren't trying! Stay corrupt, Osterra! We'll see you for the next round of carnage! Goodnight and keep your weapons sharpened! üéôÔ∏èüíÄ
